title.narrative: SANITATION AND HYGIENE SYSTEMS

description.narrative: 1.4 million most vulnerable population in emergency affected and underserved areas use sustainable, equitable and gender sensitive improved sanitation facilities and practice proper hygiene., which contributes to Education â€“ General, Health â€“ General, Hygiene, Nutrition â€“ General, Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children, especially adolescents (both boys and girls), families and communities in the most deprived localities are resilient and adopt appropriate practices to reduce their vulnerability.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 1.4 million most vulnerable population in emergency affected and underserved areas use sustainable, equitable and gender sensitiveimproved sanitation facilities and practice proper hygiene.

description.narrative: 429,083 (31% of the 2017 target) emergency affected and vulnerable rural people ensured access to improved sanitation facilities. 8,591,951 emergency affected and vulnerable rural population were reached with hygiene promotion, as it formed a major line of defence against the AWD. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:16/01/2018
